alert.note: Alert for Blount; Jefferson; Knox; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 3:23PM CDT until August 12 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Blount County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Jefferson County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Knox County in east Tennessee... Central Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... South Knoxville, Sevierville, Pigeon Forge, Pittman Center, McMahan, Kodak, Harrisburg, Kimberlin Heights, Seymour, Fairgarden, Bird Crossing, Chestnut Hill, Lake Forest, Wildwood and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
